english: drunken old man; reveler; Ouyang Xiu’s persona

etymology.description: 醉(drunk/intoxicated) + 翁(old man/elder) = drunken old man; reveler; literary persona (esp. Ouyang Xiu).
etymology.interpretation: Combines intoxication with a respectful term for an elder, evoking a genial, wine-loving gentleman. In classical usage, especially with Ouyang Xiu, it signals a persona who enjoys wine while seeking delight beyond it.

examples.chinese: 欧阳修自号醉翁(歐陽修自號醉翁)。
游人慕名来到醉翁亭，感受“醉翁之意不在酒”的意境(遊人慕名來到醉翁亭，感受「醉翁之意不在酒」的意境)。
examples.pinyin: Yóurén mùmíng láidào Zuìwēngtíng, gǎnshòu “Zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ” de yìjìng.
examples.english: Visitors come to Zuiweng Pavilion to feel the mood of 'the drunken old man’s intent is not in the wine'.

examples.chinese: 他喝得微醺，自称醉翁，自嘲又自乐(他喝得微醺，自稱醉翁，自嘲又自樂)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hē de wēixūn, zìchēng zuìwēng, zìcháo yòu zìlè.
examples.english: Slightly tipsy, he called himself a drunken old man, half-mocking and half-pleased.
